quest.name: Reap the Whirlwind
journal: Swift is determined to stop the rabble-rousing merchant from sowing further sedition.

* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to the terrified refugee in Lost Hope.

※The Main Scenario Guide shows the next available quest. You can toggle it on and off in Character Configuration, under UI Settings.

It would seem that word has spread of the drubbing you dealt the refugees of Lost Hope... Unsurprisingly, Landebert has no intention of listening to your side of the story, nor less of helping you. Yet in a curious twist of fate, your quarry chooses that exact moment to return to Pearl Lane, presumably hoping to recruit more refugees. As your eyes meet, the merchant grasps the situation and turns to flee. Do not let him escape!

As one would expect, the merchant is quick to deny your accusations, and equally quick to confess when pressed. He offers to divulge all that he knows, only to fall at your feet a moment later, an arrow having pierced his chest. The commotion draws the attention of two Stone Torches, one of whom would like to know why you are standing next to a dead man.

You explain to the Stone Torch that the merchant was felled by an arrow from afar, and that he was the subject of your investigation into the refugee uprisings. Satisfied with your statement, the Stone Torch bids you carry on with your work. Return to the Hall of Flames and report your findings to Commander Swift.

Swift concludes that the merchant was murdered to protect the identity of his employer. Despite this setback, he seems confident that the identity of the uprising's true orchestrator will soon be revealed.
objectives: * This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to the terrified refugee in Lost Hope.

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: This merchant has not only publicly incited sedition within the sultanate, but gone so far as to provide materiel support to would-be belligerents. It galls me that his role in the uprising should have escaped our notice for so long. Yet I can well imagine why it did. Rightly or wrongly, those with whom he consorts do not trust us.

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: Alas, trust is not easily gained, even in times of peace. We must nevertheless try, for I believe it is only with the cooperation of the refugees that we will catch our quarry. And so I would have you to continue your investigation in Pearl Lane.

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: We know that the merchant sought to recruit the people of Lost Hope and Stonesthrow, so it seems reasonable to assume that he may have approached the residents of Pearl Lane as well. After all, the first riots occurred within the city itself.

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: Most, if not all, will refuse to discuss this subject with you, but there is one who may be willing to do so: a man named Landebert. He too has his misgivings about us, but I believe he understands that these riots do little to further his people's cause.

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: Landebert will not let us down, I think. He is well aware of the precariousness of his compatriots' position within the sultanate. Should he happen to forget, of course, you have my permission to remind him.

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: First comes a man with the promise of deliverance. Seen your suffering firsthand and will bear it no longer, says he. Your friend, your ally, your comrade-in-arms─take his hand, and he will guide you to a better tomorrow.

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: Then comes a soldier with the promise of justice. Follow the man who came before at your peril, says shehe, for they who sow the wind shall reap the whirlwind.

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: The man's no saint; any fool can see that. We're but tools for his task, to be used and discarded. As for this soldier, shehe thinks only of herhis mission. SheHe's more honest than the man, but every bit as ruthless, make no mistake.

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: With whom shall I cast my lot? Neither, says I. Far as I'm concerned, you're no better than the bastard you pursue.

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: Now the soldier is thinking how else shehe might get what shehe wants. SheHe's tried the diplomatic approach and failed; mayhap a firmer hand is needed.

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: Mayhap shehe needs to make an example out of this Ala Mhigan scum like shehe did those five fools from Lost Hope!

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: Well you'll get no justification from me, soldier, if that's what you're waiting for. I'll not raise a hand against you.

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: But neither will I lend a hand to help you.

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: ...Not that it makes any difference. Pah! The gods seem bent on granting your every bloody wish.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: There you are, Landebert! Have you given any thought to my proposal?

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: You! I... I...

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: There he goes, towards the Gate of Thal! Go and claim your prize for coin and country!

dialogue.name: LANDEBERT
dialogue.text: Didn't you want justice for Ul'dah? Why are you still here and not scouring central Thanalan? Keen to teach me a lesson before you go?

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: You found him!? Then why is he not here!? Stop wasting valuable time and go to central Thanalan!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: You again!? Wh-Why are you pursuing me!?

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: Sedition!? Treason!? Revolution!? Th-That's preposterous!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: Who has filled your head with these lies? Refugees? The selfsame refugees who terrorized the streets of Ul'dah? Hah!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: You have no evidence to prove your accusations! None!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: N-No, I will not accompany you to the Hall of Flames. You have no right to detain me...

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: F-F-For the sake of argument, let us say I did do the things you claim. Surely you don't think I give a Qiqirn's arse about politics? It was business─only business.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01445
dialogue.text: We both know I am not the one you want. However, if you agree to protect me, I swear I shall tell you everything.

dialogue.name: GUARD01445
dialogue.text: What's all this commotion!?

dialogue.name: GUARD01445
dialogue.text: Seven hells...

dialogue.name: GUARD01445
dialogue.text: Tell the others to spread out and search the area. The killer may still be close.

dialogue.name: GUARDLEADER01445
dialogue.text: Hold, adventurer. I would know more about your relationship with the victim, as well as the events leading up to his death.

dialogue.name: GUARDLEADER01445
dialogue.text: This man was responsible for the recent riots? Mayhap we owe his murderer a debt of gratitude.

dialogue.name: GUARDLEADER01445
dialogue.text: In any case, it is obvious you are not the one whom we seek. You may carry on with your investigation, Scion.

dialogue.name: GUARDLEADER01445
dialogue.text: If that arrow was shot from where you indicated, the archer must have a good eye...and a better arm.

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: What news, [GC Rank] SurnameForename? Where is the merchant?

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: Murdered!? Damn it all to the seventh hell!

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: He was not simply murdered, [GC Rank]Forename─he was silenced. Too many knew his face, and he was ready to divulge his secrets.

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: Do not despair, though. We may be closer to identifying the true orchestrator of these riots than you realize.
